    • toMainWindow

      public void toMainWindow(javafx.event.ActionEvent actionEvent) throws IOException
      This method returns the user to the main window.
      Parameters:
      actionEvent - Triggers upon pressing the cancel button.
      Throws:
      IOException

    • saveChanges

      public void saveChanges(javafx.event.ActionEvent actionEvent) throws IOException
      This method saves changes made to the product. This method carries out a basic logic check to determine all data inputted is valid before saving the product to the allProducts list from the Inventory class. FUTURE ENHANCEMENT: Provide a window showing most associated parts as a suggestion for any possible parts to be added.
      Parameters:
      actionEvent - This event triggers upon pressing the saveProductButton.
      Throws:
      IOException

    • setIsAddOrModify

      public static void setIsAddOrModify(boolean trigger)
      This method sets the boolean to record whether a product is being added or modified.
      Parameters:
      trigger - This parameter indicates whether a product is being added or modified.

    • removeAssociatePart

      public void removeAssociatePart(javafx.event.ActionEvent actionEvent)
      This method removes any associated parts from the product. The selected associated part from the associatedParts TableView is removed after a confirmation warning.
      Parameters:
      actionEvent - This event triggers upon pressing the deleteAssPart button.

    • addAssociatePart

      public void addAssociatePart(javafx.event.ActionEvent actionEvent)
      This method adds an associated part to the product. The selected part from the availParts TableView is added to the list of associated parts. RUNTIME ERROR: Previously, an exception occurred when adding associate parts to the product, stating an InvokationException occured. This is due to the fact that no product object existed within this method. To solve this, a product was constructed to serve as the placeholder for the associatedPartsList.
      Parameters:
      actionEvent - This event triggers upon pressing the addAssPart button.

    • searchAvailPart

      public void searchAvailPart(javafx.event.ActionEvent actionEvent)
      This event passes search criteria for any available parts. The data from the availPartField is determined to be an integer or a string, and is then passed to the lookupPart method from the Inventory class and returns a list containing parts that fulfill search criteria.
      Parameters:
      actionEvent - This event triggers upon pressing the Enter key in the availPartField.
